subNodes.conversationText: root
"No doubt you have questions."
"Why weren't you with the rest of your men when they were killed, Kano?"
"On our journey to South Worlde we came across a strange lizard like woman. The Captain thought she was a threat and ordered me to take her back to the tower for questioning."
Continue

"I have heard of such creatures. They are called Iskin. They live in the swamps west of Gungerad. They fightening in appearance but not generally violent, and it is unusual to hear of one so far from the swamps."
"Where is the Iskin now?"
"It is in the cells at the King's Guard Tower. It said nothing to me. Perhaps you should interrogate it."
"Perhaps."
"Anything else?"
"Did the Baron say anything whilst he was in your custody, Borian?"
"He barely spoke and I asked no questions. He was somewhat wild-eyed - I assumed he was thinking of the painful fate that awaited him in Blackwinter."
Continue
"Anything else?"
"Who knew that the Baron was being kept here?"

"We kept the information as closely guarded as we could. The ranger Rubian was the one who initially found the Baron roaming the woods and brought him in. Rubian is no doubt out in the woods once more if you want to speak to her."
Continue
"I recognised the Baron immediately of course, and had him locked in my basement. I sent a messenger to the Tower, a boy called Norris. The message was sealed though, was it not, Kano?"
Continue
"Indeed. Sealed and opened by the Captain. He sent the boy back without knowledge of its contents."
Continue
"On my side, all of the Guard knew. But they are now all dead, except for Gilhean who was left behind to guard the tower. I cannot believe he had anything to do with this, though."
"Perhaps. Perhaps not. I should speak to him."
"Anything else?"
"Any suggestions about where to start looking?"

"There are may bandits roaming the woods these days, hungry for gold and power. It could be one of their groups. I would think the Skaal more likely, however. They live in the caves at the base of the Shadowy Mountains and often have their claws in murky dealings."
Continue
"There is also another village further east, at the base of Lake Lassinon, called Lakeside."
Continue
"I very much doubt they would have anything to do with this, Kano."
Continue
"No, probably not. The only other lead I can offer is to investigate the ambush of the King's Guard. Perhaps whoever attacked us left a clue."
Continue
"Anything else?"
"I think I've heard enough."
"Whatever you do next, I would like to come with you. Both our necks are on the line with this."
"You would be most welcome, Kano."
"I will fight by your side until we have the Baron back!"
Continue
"Very touching. Keep me informed of what you find during your investigations."
"That depends on what I find, Borian."
"Of course."
"You've already failed once. I have no need of you."
"A very sensible choice, I feel."
Continue

"I have no trust in you finding the Baron on your own. I will leave town tonight and neither of you will see me again."

Kano spins on his heel and leaves the room.
Continue
"Well, I think we've found our scapegoat. Keep me informed of what you find during your investigations."
"That depends on what I find, Borian."
